right, but my idea is that if you can get gui on the live cd to work, that means you can copy the X config from the live cd ramdisk over your X config. That usually works in cases like this

well perhaps try renaming your current xconfig and rerunning the config program

When you boot off the live cd for ubuntu, you are given a gui desktop right? That means that the live cd made a X config that works. Ok so that's good, now you said your current X config doesn't work right? So what you do is in the live cd, mount your hard drive, then go to /etc/X11 to get the X config from the live cd ramdisk, copy that x config over the one on your hd and you should be set
essentially we're using to the live cd to autoremake a working x config for you
